result.markdown:
---
title: "Getting Census data with tidycensus"
---




# Obtain and view state populations from the US Census



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
state_pop <- get_decennial(geography= "state", #every10years-complete count of US pop
                           variables="P001001")

head(state_pop)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 4
  GEOID NAME       variable    value
  <chr> <chr>      <chr>       <dbl>
1 01    Alabama    P001001   4779736
2 02    Alaska     P001001    710231
3 04    Arizona    P001001   6392017
4 05    Arkansas   P001001   2915918
5 06    California P001001  37253956
6 22    Louisiana  P001001   4533372
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
## The American Community Survey, or ACS, in contrast, is a survey of around 3 million households taken every year. Whereas the decennial Census asks only about core demographic characteristics like age and race, the ACS asks a much broader range of questions.


state_income <- get_acs(geography= "state", ## estimates
                        variables = "B19013_001")

# 90% confidence

head(state_income)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 5
  GEOID NAME       variable   estimate   moe
  <chr> <chr>      <chr>         <dbl> <dbl>
1 01    Alabama    B19013_001    54943   377
2 02    Alaska     B19013_001    80287  1113
3 04    Arizona    B19013_001    65913   387
4 05    Arkansas   B19013_001    52123   458
5 06    California B19013_001    84097   236
6 08    Colorado   B19013_001    80184   450
```
:::
:::


## Household Income  2017-2021 5-year ACS


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
income <- get_acs(geography = "county",    
                  state = "OR",
                  variables = c(hhincome = "B19013_001"))

summary(income)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
    GEOID               NAME             variable            estimate    
 Length:36          Length:36          Length:36          Min.   :42095  
 Class :character   Class :character   Class :character   1st Qu.:52293  
 Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Median :58454  
                                                          Mean   :60885  
                                                          3rd Qu.:65843  
                                                          Max.   :92025  
      moe      
 Min.   :1208  
 1st Qu.:2214  
 Median :3271  
 Mean   :3679  
 3rd Qu.:4725  
 Max.   :8250  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
median_income <-58453.5

## Oregon hh_income median =58453.5, Mean =60885


three_counties <- income %>%
 filter(NAME %in% c("Clackamas County, Oregon", "Multnomah County, Oregon", "Washington County, Oregon"))

head(three_counties)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 3 × 5
  GEOID NAME                      variable estimate   moe
  <chr> <chr>                     <chr>       <dbl> <dbl>
1 41005 Clackamas County, Oregon  hhincome    88517  1424
2 41051 Multnomah County, Oregon  hhincome    76290  1208
3 41067 Washington County, Oregon hhincome    92025  1484
```
:::
:::
